name: Incense Ashcrystals
desc: When a person burns incense to enter a state of clairvoyance, the ash leftover from the consumed incense condenses into these crystals. The sides reflect the time that was spent Spiritseeking.

value.text:
Version 5.2 Event - Iktomi Spiritseeking Scrolls
Event Quest - Spiritseeking Journey
Activity - Search for Lost Spirits
Activity - Evil Banisher
Activity - Restoring Fragmented Records

customize.name: Incense Ashcrystals
customize.desc: When a person burns incense to enter a state of clairvoyance, the ash leftover from the consumed incense condenses into these crystals. The sides reflect the time that was spent Spiritseeking.

customize.name: Calamity of Eshu
customize.desc: A ceremonial blade forged by Sanhaj, the great high priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind. In tales of bygone days, Sanhaj could use this curved blade to perform rituals, blurring the boundary between the Night Kingdom and the present world.

customize.name: Incense Ashcrystals
customize.desc: When a person burns incense to enter a state of clairvoyance, the ash leftover from the consumed incense condenses into these crystals. The sides reflect the time that was spent Spiritseeking.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Shuttle of Odara
customize.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "Calamity of Eshu."
Refracting an eerie, prism-like light, this jade pendant emits a chilling aura that does not disappear, even were it to be cast within a roaring blaze.
In ancient shamanic traditions, the "shuttle" symbolizes a medium that pierces through different realms. It is said that in the era of barbarism, before humans knew how to count their days or to weave their tales, the mighty dragons who then roamed the Soulfire Plains had a word for a construct that traversed the pitch-black darkness between the stars. In their long-forgotten language, they called such creations "Void Shuttles" — blazing javelins that could pierce anything, even a veil thick enough to enshroud an entire world.
Of course, given that the source of this story was the crafty trickster Sanhaj, it may well be that this was nothing but another of his countless tall tales, told with the sole intention of earning himself a meal and a drink. Today, some of the most respected priests of the Masters of the Night-Wind still hold this view.

customize.name: Crown of Insight
customize.desc:
A precious Talent Level-Up material.
Once a medium for the storage and transfer of wisdom in ancient times. Now, wisdom is found in ancient texts and in profound speech. Nevertheless, this Crown of Insight must still be able to impart some transcendent power and wisdom to its bearer.
